puzzle.title: Urgent Communiqu√©
puzzle.hint: You can solve this as a cryptogram without using the images at all. The images only provide hints on which letters transform into which other letters.
Each image is of something that becomes something else. For example, that (R)obot turns into an (A)mbulance.
The first letter of each image matches one of the letters in the message. To check your answers, the result letters are in alphabetical order.

The images are:
- R atchet (or robot) - C aterpillar - K itten - Z ygote - J ekyll - A corn - F rog - P ettigrew - W inter - L ightning

Change each letter of the message into what the corresponding image turns into:
- R => A mbulance - C => B utterfly - K => C at - Z => E mbryo - J => H yde - A => O ak - F => P rince - P => R at - W => S pring - L => Thunder
The solution is REPORT TO THE SECRET BASE.

puzzle.title: It's Just Dinner
puzzle.hint: Start with finding the four corners, and go from there. Things with large spaces are more likely to be corners.
The two plates should be next to each other and the napkin. The three glasses should be together. All the silverware is together.

CORNERS:
- Lower-left: Large doily/placemat - Upper-left: Napkin - Upper-right: Fork - Lower-right: Water Glass

FULL LAYOUT
- Top Row: Napkin, 2 plates (top and bottom), pepper, salt, fork (top), knife (middle), spoon (bottom) - Bottom Row: Doily, Wine glass, champagne, water glass.
The shapes form letters. Try to read them.

puzzle.title: Ancient Runes
puzzle.hint: "See past obscuring connections to decode" is the hint. DECODE means use your code sheet.
Check the puzzling basics for flavor text words that are used for clues to certain codes
"see" in the flavortext is a clue for Braille. You need to see past (ignore) the lines connecting the points.
ALEPH TAV BETH SHIN

puzzle.title: Spy Newspaper
puzzle.hint: Your task is to look for puzzling clues in each news article that point to a single letter. Try looking for key words, acrostics, and use your code sheet! Individual clues are below.
A NEW...The article is describing a semaphore ^.
TONIGHT'S...double is the clue word. Notice any doubles?
ON THIS SAD...Look it up on your code sheet.
RADIOACTIVE...Look for a pattern among the lines
THE CITY'S...Acrostics are not just the first letter of each line.
NATO...Look for the NATO letter in the article.
CONGRASS...A certain common letter seems to be missing.
FOR THE...Just look at the shape of the article

puzzle.title: The Enigma Machine
puzzle.hint: "bandwith" is a clue that you should interpret the binary code as number relating to the two adjacent components together
Decode the binary using the code sheet into a number. This number is the sum of the number of letters in the specified components.

If you start with the 3 connection, it's easy to get (OS, X) as the pair. Continue to make sensible matches from there along the chain, as you'll know exactly how many letters are in the next connected word.
Read the first letter of each of the grey spaces in (1) then (2) order to get your required 8 letter answer

puzzle.title: The Secret Message (meta puzzle)
puzzle.hint: The first step is to use the bacon cipher encoding by looking at the bolded letters of the flavor text itself.
The "grid you already made" is the actual engima puzzle. Use the first letter of each answer as the playfair grid

puzzle.title: A Look Back (bonus puzzle and 2017 meta-meta)
puzzle.hint: There's nothing tricky about the crossword grid. Just fill in the answers based on the clues.
There seems to be something almost familiar about some of the crossword answers and some words from the 12 meta answers.
You will need to reuse some grey hexes multiple times, but it'll always refer to the important letter.
If you change the letter of a grey hex, you can get one of the words in one of the 12 the meta answers
Fill into the final answer the original letter from the meta answer that got changed in the grey hex.
